summary: The Youth Workforce Readiness Act of 2025 aims to establish a grant program to support out-of-school-time workforce readiness programs for youth aged 6-18 (or 19 if in secondary school). The bill focuses on providing employability skills development, career exploration, employment readiness training, mentoring, work-based learning, and workforce opportunities. It defines key terms like 'eligible youth' and 'workforce readiness program,' outlines eligibility requirements for grant recipients, specifies required application content, and details program activities, including education and workforce readiness services, to be offered. The bill also amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act regarding youth councils and mandates evaluations and reporting on program effectiveness, including the establishment of youth councils in local boards.
